name: Introduction to Sociology
description: This course provides an overview of the discipline of sociology, focusing on the understanding of social structure, social change, and social organization.

name: Political Sociology
description: This course is an introduction to the study of power, politics, and social change through the lens of sociology.

name: Political Institutions and Behavior
description: This course examines the relationships among political institutions and the behavior of citizens and policy makers.

name: Political Economy
description: This course explores the relationship between politics, economics, and social structure.

name: Comparative Politics
description: This course examines the politics of other countries, including their political systems, institutions, and public policies.
